abstract.p: Michael G Williams, vice president and chief information officer of The New York Times, is promoted to same posts at newspaper's parent company; he will also retain positions at the newspaper; photo (S)

block.p: Michael G. Williams, a vice president and the chief information officer of The New York Times, has been promoted to the same posts at the newspaper's parent company. He will also retain the positions at the newspaper.

His appointment was announced yesterday by Michael Golden, vice chairman and senior vice president of the Times Company. Mr. Williams joined the newspaper in October 1998 from the Seagram Company's spirits and wine group, where he was vice president for information technology and chief technology officer.
